author: Special Correspondent
text:
A group of teachers with disabilities staged a protest on Saturday. This was the third day of their protest, said R. Sudhakar, president of the TN Differently Abled Specially Trained Teachers’ Welfare Association. “All we are asking for is employment for us,” he said.

Mr. Sudhakar said the teachers had been trained at a government teachers’ training institute in Poonamallee.

“While those trained between 2004 and 2008 got jobs in 2010, those trained from 2008 onwards to 2013 are still waiting. There are 75 of us who are waiting. The institute was shut down eventually as no one was joining due to lack of jobs,” he claimed.
title: Association for people with disabilities stages protest
